thread.title: Volkswagen Names New CEO: What You Need to Know About the Emissions Scandal
thread.title_full: Volkswagen Names New CEO: What You Need to Know About the Emissions Scandal

title: Volkswagen Names New CEO: What You Need to Know About the Emissions Scandal
text:
Volkswagen Names New CEO: What You Need to Know About the Emissions Scandal Written by: Laurie Kulikowski 09/25/15 - 1:11 PM EDT 
This story has been updated from Sept. 24, 2015 with news that Volkswagen has named a new CEO. NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Volkswagen has named Matthias Müller as its next CEO, replacing Martin Winterkorn, who resigned earlier this week after the company admitted to deliberately cheating on U.S. emissions tests. Appointing Müller, 62, is the latest development as the embattled German car manufacturer reels from the scandal. Müller, 62, is chairman of the car maker's Porsche division and will continue in both roles until a successor has been found, Volkswagen announced on Friday. 
Despite blanket coverage by news media with updates on the scandal, lots of people are still asking questions on Google and social media. Social media is calling the Volkswagen emissions scandal #DieselGate and #VWGate, a reference to Watergate. 
And we're going to answer them for you. We looked at some of the most popular questions about VW on Google and social media to bring you the answers. More Headlines
